item.title: Japanese city challenges residents to limit smartphone use to two hours a day
item.description: The city of Nagoya has launched a directive that asks residents to limit the use of smartphones to two hours a day, in a measure that, although it does not result in a fine, aims to promote a healthier relationship with screens. Masafumi Kouki, mayor of this town, explained to France-Presse (AFP) that he had been concerned for several months about the “negative effects of the excessive use of smartphones, particularly the sharp decline in direct human communication”. "Even on trains, everyone is looking at their cell phones, no one talks to others anymore. I wanted to create an opportunity for our residents to reflect", he confided during an interview. A “local law” on the proper use of cell phones, laptops and tablets was approved by the city council by 12 votes to 7, before coming into force last week — applying to both adults and children. In this suburb of Nagoya, an industrial metropolis in central Japan, the aim is not to impose penalties for exceeding the limit, but rather to encourage self-regulation. When the law was first proposed, “opposition was almost unanimous” in the city, but many citizens changed their minds when they learned that the “daily limit” does not include work or study time and that it is a recommendation, says the mayor. Not enough to convince all of the approximately 68,000 inhabitants of Toyoake. “Nowadays, we do everything — study, entertainment, communication — with a single smartphone,” argued Shutaro Kihara, a 22-year-old law student, who considers the regulation “quite useless or ineffective” for young people. Councilor Mariko Fujie, 50, voted against, considering that, although the excessive use of smartphones is a social problem that deserves to be addressed, she has “strong reservations about the idea of ​​regulating people's free time through a decree”. Primary school student Ikka Ito, who plays video games near a local train station, says he uses his cell phone four to five hours a day. “I started voluntarily reducing my screen time since the announcement”, without my parents asking for it, he assured. Good sleep With the aim of improving sleep, the bill recommends that primary school students avoid screens after 9pm, while primary school students and older are encouraged to turn them off after 10pm. Research has revealed that Japanese people sleep less than people in other developed countries, often due to long working hours. Studies also show that, in addition to interfering with sleep, which can affect mental health, intensive use of social media is associated with loneliness, depression and anxiety. The mayor has two children, aged 10 and 7, who do not have a smartphone, although the older one sometimes borrows his mother's, and his family now avoids screens during meals.

item.title: Macau | Public accounts with losses in September
item.description: Macau's public accounts reveal that the region lost 57.4 million patacas in September, after a budget review to reinforce social support. According to data published online by the Financial Services Directorate (DSF), the territory recorded a surplus in public accounts of 14.8 billion patacas in the first nine months of the year. However, this value represents a drop of 0.39 percent compared to the end of August, when Macau had a surplus of 14.9 billion patacas. Even so, the surplus between January and September was 3 percent higher than in the same period last year and is already more than double the Government's initial forecast for the entire year 2025: 6.83 billion patacas. Macau closed 2024 with a surplus of 15.8 billion patacas, more than double that recorded in the previous year. The loss recorded in September was due to public expenditure, which increased by 18.6 percent in just one month, reaching 68.2 billion patacas. The main reason for this increase was spending on social support and subsidies, which grew by practically a quarter (24.9 percent) compared to August, to 38.7 billion patacas. At the beginning of July, the Macau parliament approved a Government proposal to increase the expenses foreseen in the budget by 2.86 billion patacas, to reinforce social support. The review includes the creation of a subsidy, worth a total of MOP54,000, for children up to three years old, in an attempt to increase the lowest birth rate in the world. Spending on the Administration's Investment and Expense Plan also rose 11.9 percent compared to August, to 12.3 billion patacas. The increase in expenditure was balanced by Macau's current revenue, which rose 1.6 percent in the first nine months of the year, to 82.6 billion patacas. The main reason for the increase was a 6 percent increase, to 70.4 billion patacas, in revenue from gambling taxes – which represent 85.2 percent of the total. The city's six gaming operators pay a direct tax of 35 percent on gaming revenue, with 2.3 percent going to the Macau Social Security Fund and urban and tourism development, and 1.6 percent given to the Macau Foundation for cultural, educational, scientific, academic and philanthropic purposes. Total revenue from Macau's casinos reached 181.3 billion patacas in the first nine months of the year, 7.1 percent more than in the same period of 2024.

item.title: Suspicious transactions in casinos fall 9.5 percent until September
item.description: The number of suspicious transactions recorded in casinos fell by 9.5 percent in the first nine months of 2025, compared to the same period last year, according to official data. The Financial Information Office (GIF) reported that the six casino operators submitted, in total, 2,751 reports of transactions suspected of money laundering or terrorist financing. In a statement released on Thursday, GIF pointed to “the decrease in the number of reports of suspicious transactions reported by the gaming sector” until September as the main reason for an 8.9 percent drop in the total number. Between January and September, the office received 4,118 submissions, 73.3 percent of which came from casino concessionaires, while 21 percent came from banks and insurance companies and 5.7 percent from other institutions and entities. The referenced sectors, including pawn shops, jewelry stores, real estate agencies and auction houses, are obliged to report to the authorities any transaction equal to or greater than 500 thousand patacas. In 2024, GIF had received 5,245 participations, the majority of which came from the territory's casinos: 3,837, 11.8 percent more than in the previous year and a new record. Everyone agree According to GIF's annual report, Macau was the only member of the Asia-Pacific Anti-Money Laundering Group (FATF) that complied with “all 40 international standards” on preventing money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office signed agreements to exchange information with 33 countries and territories, including the Financial Information Unit of the Judicial Police of Portugal, in 2008, the Financial Information Unit of the Central Bank of Timor-Leste, in 2018, and, in 2019, the Financial Activities Control Council of Brazil and the Financial Information Unit of Cape Verde. In July, GIF said that it had finalized the procedures to sign, also with Angola, an information exchange agreement to prevent money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office said that the agreement was on the table at a meeting with representatives of the Financial Information Unit of the Republic of Angola, on the sidelines of the Egmont Group meeting between 6 and 11 July, in Luxembourg. The Egmont Group is an international anti-money laundering organization, which brings together 181 information units from around the world.

item.title: Macau and Hong Kong receive work by Carlos Paredes next year
item.description: Carlos Paredes' work will be on a world tour, visiting 15 countries, starting from Monday, over the course of six months, a project with the concept and artistic direction of musicians André Varandas and Bruno Costa. The “Paredes Experience” project includes a total of 40 initiatives, which include the “100 Paredes” concerts, lectures, meetings with schools and universities, and other actions with Portuguese communities around the world, promoting “the sound and spirit of Carlos Paredes”, André Varandas told the Lusa agency. "It is a rare event, for a Portuguese musical project to circulate for almost six months, uninterruptedly, across 15 countries. It is something that makes us very proud and with an added responsibility", he stressed. The piano and bass guitar of André Varandas are joined by the Portuguese guitar of Bruno Costa, the two mentors and performers of “Paredes Experience”, who, on stage, on the world tour, will also feature the collaboration of Nuno Botelho (classical guitar). The world tour opens today, in Guinea-Bissau, where it will remain until the 18th. An “artistic journey” The authors explained to Lusa that the “Paredes Experience” is “an artistic journey that reaffirms the Portuguese guitar as Portugal’s identity instrument and, simultaneously, proves its universal language”. “On stage, tradition and modernity intersect, evoking the legacy of Carlos Paredes and projecting it into the future through new sounds, cultural dialogues and multidisciplinary international collaborations”, they said. After Guinea-Bissau, the “Paredes Experience” heads to Dili, in Timor-Leste, where it will stay between the 21st and 30th of this month, flying to the east coast of the United States (USA), from the 6th to the 13th of November, with actions scheduled for New York, New Bedford and New Jersey. Between November 27th and December 4th, Argentina is the destination, with performances scheduled for the capital, Buenos Aires, and Córdoba, the second most populous city in that South American country. Montevideo, in Uruguay, will host the “Paredes Experience” between December 5th and 9th, before a first return to Europe, in this case to Italian Tuscany, in the towns of Pontedera and Buti (December 11th to 14th). At the beginning of 2026, Carlos Paredes' music will echo in Poland, between the 9th and 17th of January, then heading to China and the territories of Macau and Hong Kong, in locations yet to be announced, from the 19th to the 26th of the same month. The “Paredes Experience” world tour has its finale scheduled for São Paulo, Brazil, with initiatives scheduled from March 12th to 23rd. In the year that marks the centenary of the birth of Carlos Paredes (1925-2025), André Varandas and Bruno Costa promoted, in Portugal, the “100 Paredes” project, which proposed “a global celebration of the life and work of who is unanimously recognized as one of the greatest symbols of Portuguese culture and the universality of the Portuguese guitar”. In total, there were more than 80 initiatives including socio-community concerts, lectures and a traveling exhibition, among other actions.

item.title: NBA | Peace resumed and return to Macau after six years
item.description:
The Venetian Arena was the stage for the NBA's historic return to China. And throughout the weekend, several celebrities such as David Beckham, Jackie Chan or Jack Ma were in the stands to watch the pre-season games
On Friday, around 14,000 people watched the first game between teams from the North American Basketball League (NBA) in China after six years of disruption. More than an hour and a half before the start of the match between the Brooklyn Nets and the Phoenix Suns, hundreds of fans were already queuing up to enter the Venetian Arena, which will host NBA pre-season games for five years. Although basketball is one of the most popular sports in China, the main motivation for those who came early was the various performances by musical groups from the interior of neighboring Hong Kong before the opening whistle. Neither team is tipped to succeed the Oklahoma City Thunder as NBA champions, but in the completely full stands, there seemed to be more fans of the Nets, who have Zeng Fanbo on their squad. The 22-year-old left the Beijing Ducks, from the Chinese capital, to sign in August with the Nets, owned by the president of Chinese technology giant Alibaba, Joe Tsai Chung-Hsin. Zeng was chosen to speak to the fans before kick-off and received one of the biggest ovations of the night when he first came on with three minutes remaining in the first half. With the ball rolling, the Nets dominated, reaching the break with an advantage (71-59), in a lukewarm match, despite a lot of noise made by the fans, especially with each 'dunk' or triple shot. Luxury assistance The organizers did their best to keep the atmosphere buzzing, even launching souvenirs attached to mini parachutes from the roof of the arena and the football world lent a helping hand, with former England international David Beckham sitting in the front row, alongside Hong Kong actor Jackie Chan, Joe Tsai and Alibaba founder Jack Ma. Timeouts were used to bring Chinese celebrities to the floor, including members of Hong Kong's most famous band, Mirror, or former NBA legends, including two former rivals: Shaquille O'Neal and Chinese Yao Ming. "I remember watching Yao Ming play for the [Houston] Rockets when I was little. But this was the first time I saw the NBA live. It was crazy!", she told Lusa Fang, 33 years old. This Suns fan, who flew two thousand kilometers from Beijing, was still hoarse after watching the team come back in the second half and win 132-127, after extra time, after more than three hours. The Nets have an opportunity to get revenge on Sunday, when the two teams meet again, in the same arena. More important than the result was the return to China. The NBA has not played games in China since 2019, when Daryl Morey, then general manager of the Houston Rockets, demonstrated support for anti-government protests in Hong Kong on social media. “Most of these fans unfortunately didn't have the opportunity to watch [NBA] games, but we gave them a show here and we felt supported,” said Nets coach Jordi Fernández after the game. The NBA refused to punish Daryl Morey, but Chinese state television CCTV stopped broadcasting American league games, a hiatus that cost $400 million in lost revenue. But the passion for basketball in China has not faded, said Suns star Devin Booker: “I haven't felt this level of passion in a long time (…). It was important for the NBA to come back here.”

item.title: Health | Suicide attempts among children double by June
item.description:
Between January and June, a total of 14 children aged up to 14 tried to end their lives. During this period, there were at least 101 suicide attempts
At least 14 children up to the age of 14 tried to end their lives in the first half of the year, double the number recorded in the same period in 2024, according to Canal Macau. Between January and June, there were at least 101 suicide attempts, including 14 children aged between 5 and 14, Macau Television reported on Thursday night. According to data from the Secretary for Security's office, the largest number of suicide attempts (30) occurred in the age group between 15 and 24 years old, while two thirds (67) were carried out by women. Despite this, the numbers released by Wong Sio Chak's office reveal a decrease, since, in the first half of 2024, 125 suicide attempts had been recorded. Throughout last year there were 249 suicide attempts, eight fewer than in 2023. In the first half of last year, the Macau Health Services (SSM) recorded 44 deaths by suicide, three fewer than in the same period of 2023, including a 12-year-old young man. At the time, the SSM said that “the possible causes of suicide are mainly the result of mental illness and problems related to gambling or finances”. Unknown data The head of the Division of Prevention and Treatment of Problem Gambling at the Institute of Social Action (IAS) reminded journalists on Friday that a survey on young people's participation in games of chance is almost finished. Social organization Sheng Kung Hui launched a survey among young people aged between 13 and 35 in June, which is running until October 17, said Bonnie Wu I Mui. On the sidelines of an academic forum on gambling addiction, the director admitted that the IAS does not have “the exact number of suicides related to compulsive gambling” and forwarded the question to the Health Services (SSM). But according to TDM, since the data on suicides between January and March were revealed at the end of May, the SSM has not released this statistic, usually published quarterly, again. In the most recent balance, Macau recorded 18 deaths by suicide, four fewer than in the first three months of 2024. According to a count made by TDM, based on messages sent to the press by the region's Judicial Police, there were at least 60 deaths that could be attributed to suicide until the beginning of October. Anyone who is emotionally distressed or considers themselves to be in a desperate situation should call the “Caritas Hope for Life” Hotline on 28525222 in order to obtain emotional counseling services.

item.title: Restoration | New classifications and larger fines
item.description:
The legislation on licensing the restaurant sector will be reformulated, leading to an increase in fines and the standardization of the classification of these spaces, which will now have the sole name of “food and beverage establishments”. Highlight the increase in fines and greater flexibility in carrying out works
On Friday, the Executive Council concluded the discussion of a new proposed law to be submitted to the Legislative Assembly (AL), entitled “Law on restaurant and beverage activities and related establishments”, and which has as its main objective the simplification of licensing services, as well as “the combination of decentralization of powers with the management and optimization of services”. This proposed law reformulates the legislation that has existed since 1996. In practice, it is proposed to simplify the classification of catering establishments, previously classified as “restaurants”, “bars”, “drinking establishments” and “food establishments”. With the proposed law, only a single classification is used, “restaurant and beverage establishments”, with supervision being carried out by the Institute for Municipal Affairs (IAM). The “dance rooms” continue to be autonomous and under the supervision of the Directorate of Tourism Services. Furthermore, it is proposed to create “the registration regime for food and beverage establishments” and the “reformulation of complementary legal diplomas”, particularly in terms of licensing. It is also intended to “make the technical requirements that establishments are subject to comply with more flexible”. Fines to hurt Another highlight of the changes is the “increase in the amounts of fines”. At this point, the Government says it takes into account “social developments and economic changes”, thus “updating the amounts of fines applicable to the corresponding administrative infractions, with a view to reinforcing the deterrent effects”. In addition to new transitional provisions, there is also the “easing of restrictions imposed on works carried out in protection zones and provisional protection zones”. In practice, the works to be carried out “in buildings outside the published picturesque streets or in lots not immediately adjacent to classified properties or in the process of being classified do not require the prior opinion of the Cultural Institute”, which allows “relaxing the restrictions imposed on works” and accelerating renovations. On Friday, the Executive Council also concluded the analysis of the proposed law “Gold and platinum marketing regime”, taking into account that the last legislation dated back to 2003 and was no longer able to “satisfy consumers' expectations in relation to the types and quality of jewelry articles”. One of the changes involves the addition of “new definitions of platinum, gold-plated and gold-coated articles”.

item.title: IAM | Employees subject to ETAPM
item.description: The Government wants to revoke the status of the staff of the Institute for Municipal Affairs (IAM) and apply the general civil service regime to them. The proposal was presented on Friday, at the Executive Council press conference. “In view of the uniformity of the personnel management regime, the proposed law proposes the revocation of the statute of the IAM's own personnel, making it governed by the general regime of public service [Statute of Workers of the Public Administration of Macau]”, it was revealed. If the changes are approved by the Legislative Assembly, IAM workers with an “individual employment contract” will also have to sign new contracts, in this case “administrative supply contracts”. Despite the changes, the Executive states that “the counting of time previously provided and the validity of training courses attended” by these workers will not be affected. In addition to this change, the IAM will also see some competencies, considered overlapping, transferred to other departments. The IAM will therefore no longer exercise the powers of “naming public spaces”, “assigning police numbers” and “maintaining and repairing roads and drainage networks”. These functions will be transferred to the responsibility of transport and public works.

item.title: Government | Renovation is going “very well”, says André Cheong
item.description:
The Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, believes that with Wong Sio Chak at the helm, the Administration and Justice secretariat “will get better and better”
Days away from leaving the Government to become a deputy, André Cheong guaranteed that the Executive's remodeling is going “very well”. The statements by the Secretary for Administration and Justice and spokesperson for the Executive Council were made on Friday, after a meeting of the consultative body. At the end of last month it was revealed that Cheong will be a deputy from Thursday and that his role will be carried out by the current Secretary for Security, Wong Sio Chak. The security portfolio will be taken over by Chan Tsz King. On Friday, in the Executive Board's question and answer session, André Cheong addressed the changes and left a sign of confidence for his successor. “Regarding the transfer of work to Secretary Wong, both in terms of work plans and personnel, everything is going very well,” he said. The secretary who could be the future president of the Legislative Assembly, depending on the election of deputies, which takes place on Thursday, also praised Wong Sio Chak, not only because of his experience, but also because of the civil protection mechanism. “As you know, Secretary Wong Sio Chak has long administrative experience and is very competent in terms of management and leadership”, he began by indicating André Cheong. "For example, in his current functions, in terms of civil protection, during the passage of typhoon Ragasa he worked very well. I believe that this supervision [Administration and Justice] with his leadership will get better and better", he highlighted. More thanks At Friday's session, André Cheong also thanked Ho Iat Seng, former Chief Executive, and Sam Hou Fai, current leader of the Government, for their trust and appointments to the position of Secretary for Administration and Justice. This is a position Cheong has held since 2019. In addition to being secretary, he served as spokesperson for the Executive Council. In this condition, Cheong stated that he had presented more than 350 legal diplomas, including laws and regulations, a fact that he said he would not forget. Looking ahead to his duties as a deputy, the secretary promised to use his political experience in the Legislative Assembly, to promote “greater interaction and communication between the Executive and Legislative powers”.

item.title: Fogo de artifício | Festival termina com vitória do Reino Unido
item.description:
The UK pyrotechnics team, Pyrotex Fireworx, emerged as the winner of the 33rd edition of the Macau International Fireworks Festival, which ended on Saturday. Highlight for the debut, at the close of the curtain, of a Brazilian team in the competition
The United Kingdom won the Macau International Fireworks Competition, which ended with a show from Brazil, which participated in the competition for the first time, the Tourism Services Bureau (DST) announced on Saturday. In a statement, DST revealed that participating companies from the Philippines and mainland China placed second and third, respectively, in the 33rd edition of the competition. The competition ended on Saturday, with two shows: the winner, from the British pyrotechnic company Pyrotex Fireworx, and another from the Vision Show team, from Florianópolis, in Santa Catarina, which marked Brazil's debut in the competition. The end of the competition, which was scheduled for October 6, was postponed due to the passage of Typhoon Matmo, which led Macau authorities to issue tropical storm signal 8, the third highest level. The third night of the contest also had to be postponed, from September 20th to October 2nd, due to the impact of super typhoon Ragasa, the most powerful storm recorded on the planet in 2025. A series of dialogues The director of DST, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, highlighted at the awards ceremony that, despite the impact of weather conditions, the event allowed companies from various parts of the world “to deepen contacts and dialogue with industry partners”. The 33rd edition featured 10 shows, each lasting 18 minutes, combining fireworks and music, including the show by the Portuguese company Pirotecnia de Barbeita, based in Monção. The competition had a budget of 18.1 million patacas, a figure that represents a drop of around 1.1 percent compared to last year, DST told Lusa. item.title: Pyongyang | Country’s “most powerful” missile revealed in parade
item.description:
The military parade held in the capital of North Korea to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the Workers' Party was not attended by Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin
North Korea unveiled the country's “most powerful strategic nuclear weapons system” at a military parade in Pyongyang to mark the 80th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party, the state news agency reported Saturday. “When the Hwasong-20 intercontinental ballistic missile, North Korea's most powerful strategic nuclear weapons system, entered the square, public enthusiasm reached its peak,” said KCNA about Friday night's parade, which was attended by leader Kim Jong-un. This is the first public appearance of this missile, which some experts say could have multiple warheads, allowing it to attack multiple targets simultaneously and overcome anti-missile systems. Although the Hwasong-20 seeks to increase the range and destruction capacity of its predecessors, it has not yet been tested, so its operational capabilities cannot be confirmed. The event was attended by Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and Vice President of the Russian Security Council Dmitri Medvedev. However, the President of China, Xi Jinping, and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, were not present, despite speculation that Pyongyang had invited them. Kim Jong-un presided over the parade from the central tribune of Kim Il-sung Square, where, during a speech, he stressed that the North Korean armed forces must “continuously evolve into an invincible force” that eliminates any threat, according to KCNA, cited by the South Korean news agency Yonhap. Kim did not mention Seoul or Washington in his speech, limiting himself to referring to the fight against hegemony in general. Signs of strength Recently, the White House left open the possibility of negotiations with Pyongyang without preconditions, which seems to imply that the issue of denuclearization could be removed from the initial talks, in accordance with North Korean demands. Seoul, for its part, has continued to send signals of openness to dialogue, which the North Korean regime continues to ignore. Medvedev said North Korean units sent to Kursk to support Russia in the war against Ukraine marched in the parade, as cited by Russian news agency TASS. Hypersonic missiles, long-range strategic cruise missiles, anti-aircraft systems, new-generation Chonma-20 tanks and multiple launchers were also displayed during the parade, according to KCNA.

item.title: C-PLPEX and MIF take place on October 22nd
item.description: The Sino-Lusophone trade fair that opens on October 22 in Macau will feature more than 480 exhibitors from China and Portuguese-speaking countries, an increase of 60 percent, said the organization. The Trade and Investment Promotion Institute (IPIM) stated that the second edition of the Economic and Trade Exhibition of China and Portuguese-Speaking Countries (C-PLPEX) has as its theme “creating new opportunities for cooperation”. The inaugural edition of C-PLPEX, held in 2023, after six editions of the Exhibition of Products and Services of Portuguese-Speaking Countries, featured 300 companies, of which 260 came from Portuguese-speaking markets. In a statement, IPIM highlighted that exhibitors come from sectors such as agriculture, food and beverages, new energies, marine economy, cross-border e-commerce and professional services. In the case of agriculture, “innovative technologies will be presented, such as ‘drones’ [unmanned aircraft] and the use of waste”, along with “characteristic agricultural products and derivatives”, including coffee beans and cashews. Between October 22nd and 25th, C-PLPEX will also include “other links in the industrial chain, such as storage logistics and sales by agents”, highlighted IPIM. The new energy sector will prioritize “innovative products and services, including electric motorcycles, new energy space capsules, energy storage and solar energy systems”. Simultaneous with MIF The C-PLPEX program includes the launch of 13 new projects, the announcement of the winners of awards for wines and spirits and coffee from Portuguese-speaking countries and a networking session between agricultural entrepreneurs. The second edition of C-PLPEX will take place simultaneously with the 30th Macau International Fair (MIF) and the Macau 2025 Franchise Exhibition. The organization said that 20 new products and technologies will be launched during MIF, which this year features new themed pavilions dedicated to the robotics industry as well as a pavilion dedicated to Macau's healthcare brands.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Sun Yang, who lived in the time of Spring and Autumn (771-476 BC) because he was considered an exemplary judge in choosing a good horse, earned the honorific title of Bole from a king, «the happy eldest» and his praised ability to choose gave rise to the popular saying that says that «good horses capable of running a thousand li in a day (qianlima) are many, a Bole is rare». This would soon be adopted as a metaphor for all areas where it was necessary or vital to know how to choose talent, especially hidden talent such as in the selection of government employees. But this skill, specifically referring to horses, was especially valued in the time of the dynasty founded by the Mongol knights of the Yuan. The most notable painters of that time, such as Zhao Mengfu, portrayed several of the dynasty's most famous horses. And a court painter around the year 1342 showed, with indifference, a horse offered to the emperor, as was customary in the tax system with foreign countries, but which would remain as unexpected visual proof of the stay in the territory of a mission headed by the Florentine Franciscan Giovanni de Marignolli (c. 1290- 1358) who had arrived in Khanbaliq (present-day Beijing) as legate of the Pope in 1339-40, following the unprecedented reception of Giovanni da Montecorvino OFM (1247-1328) at the Yuan court, which even allowed him to build churches in the streets of the capital. This horizontal scroll made only in ink, a copy of which was probably made in the Ming dynasty and is in the Palace Museum in Beijing, is attributed to the court painter Zhou Lang, who created in another painting an unforgettable portrait of a poet whose memory is largely due to the testimony of a contemporary capable of recognizing her unique talent. Zhou Lang made the portrait of Du Qiuniang, «the Autumn Maiden» (791-835), with an ancient flute in his hands in a figurative style respecting the «spirit of the ancients» as Zhao Mengfu wanted, and on the model of the ladies of the Tang dynasty. From the portrait in this horizontal scroll (ink and color on silk, 32.3 x 285 cm in the Palace Museum in Beijing) was an exhortation to a prince, which would last and can be translated as: «I ask you, Lord: do not be dazzled / by the lives of those who carry gold / in the seams of their dresses/ My advice, Lord, / is that your green years / be well lived. / Pick the flowers when they bloom, / not when they are already falling, / Don’t wait until there are no longer / flowers on the broken branches.” It is known about the author that she was educated in the arts of dance and music and impressed a general who was defeated by an emperor and took her to his court and, following political conflicts, returned to her native Nanking. And it was there that, aged and impoverished, the poet Du Mu (803-52) found her, who wrote a poem about her and her brief biography.

item.title: Ana Cristina Alves
item.description: The philosophical questions that will arise throughout this text are based on concrete data, they are not inventions and depend on newspaper reports, but they are certainly not fake news, they just report what has been happening in the second decade of the 21st century in the People's Republic of China. China is the market leader in robotic technology, including humanoid robotics. Robotics malls are growing in Beijing, one with 4 floors, opened on August 7, 2025, another with 6 floors in Shenzhen. In this large shopping mall, there are robots for all tastes and uses in assisting medicine, industry and everyday activities. They can be bionic, with shapes and movements inspired by biology, or humanoid, reaching levels of sophistication like those seen in a chess player named Wukong. We also find them linked to sport, some play boxing, others football, others practice running, there are artists, for example, painters, musicians and dancers, there are medical assistants, masseurs, nursing technicians and laboratory assistants, and/or dedicated to traditional Chinese medicine, there are them committed to daily tasks, making excellent waiters and cooks, who attentively flip pancakes and prepare barbecues, but also counter staff, there are, in addition, humanoid transporters and drones. And if there are good ones, that is, used to help and build, obviously there could be bad ones, to hinder and destroy. But this is a conversation for later. At the World Robotics Conference in August 2025, held in Beijing, a sales balance was carried out for the year 2024 regarding industrial robots, which exceeded 300 thousand units, keeping China in top place in sales of this type of robots for the twelfth consecutive year. In a report made by the President of the Chinese Robotics Institute, Xu Xiaolan (徐晓兰), the country is the largest producer of robotics in the world, with sales of industrial robots having increased from 33,000 in 2015 to 556,000 units in 2024. The production of service robots (domestic services, storage and logistics, commercial services, support for the elderly, the disabled and rehabilitation medical) for more than 10 million units. In statistical terms, and according to data from the International Data Corporation (IDC) for 2024, Chinese manufacturers occupy 84.7% of the global market for commercial service robots. China leads the world robotics market, through its active creative industry, as it had already done in relation, for example, to toys. The country is responsible for around 80% to 90% of toys sold globally, whether old wooden toys, plush toys, inflatable toys, or electronic toys, with Guangdong, Jiangsu and Shandong being the main bases for purchasing toys, with the centers of Fujian, Zhejiang and Shanghai also being strong in this area. Centers that we also find linked to robotics, at least in the case of Shanghai and Shenzhen. Can a relationship be established between toys and robotics in the case of China? Toys are a strong focus of generation Z, short for zoomers, (those from the second half of the 90s until 2010), who fear a bleak future and invest a lot in emotional spending. This generation of the World Wide Web follows the growth of technological devices, being considered digital native. As I believe, the path for the emergence of robots in China was laid out long before Generation Z appeared on the face of the earth. The Chinese have always loved toys, see their love for stuffed animals, lanterns, old wooden toys and, more recently, all types of electronic toys. Now, robots, although they are much more than entertainment, have the appearance of toys, with the added advantage of being able to receive a strong emotional investment, combined with enormous practical utility. These “cans”, made from aluminum, steel and titanium, and plastics, such as polypropylene, ABS and polycarbonate, rubbers and elastomers, in addition to numerous electronic components, such as microprocessors, sensors, motors and wiring, are great companions of humans, faithful friends and obedience only limited to their manufacture. They therefore appear to fulfill several functions and their emergence was only possible due to a close alliance between science and technology, that is, due to the development of technology, which was thematized by great contemporary writers and philosophers in the West, and think of Aldous Huxley (1894-1963) and his futuristic dystopia, entitled Brave New World. 1932), in which a society dominated by genetic engineering is psychologically conditioned, including by drugs (soma), in order to guarantee social well-being and suppress freedom and critical thinking. Consider, also, works such as Oswald Spengler's (1880-1936), Man and Technique from 1931, which explores the relationship between human beings and technology, ultimately leading to self-destruction through the dissolution of Western culture. But if Western culture can feel, to paraphrase Spengler, “nauseated by machines”, there are others like the philosopher Martin Heidegger (1889-1976), who in The Question of Technique (1954) sees technique as the meaning of a new era for human beings. However, to do so it is necessary to know how to question the technique and not just accept it in an instrumental way at the service of anthropological purposes, when humanism for the philosopher of The Letter to Humanism (1946) has disastrous consequences, because it distances the true man from his essence and Being, which is thus hidden and not revealed. None of these paths of Western thought have been followed by the Chinese of our times, strongly committed to the utilitarian use of technology. The instrumentalization of it at the service of humanity, or rather, of China, does not raise existential doubts in them, as is attested by the large robotics shopping malls currently available in Beijing or Shenzhen to a public eager for technological innovations. Chinese robots serve all types of functions; industrial, commercial, scientific, recreational, domestic and emotional assistance. The relative lack of freedom, or the limitation of degrees of freedom (Degrees of Freedom, DOF) also does not seem worrying to them, at least to the point of raising philosophical questions about a dystopian future, viable through the genetic crossing of artificial intelligence with animals, including so-called rational humans. They only seek to improve the degrees of freedom of robots defined as the number of independent movements of their joints and components, carried out in both the rotational and translational directions, these degrees being in the Humanoid Robotic Technology article, published in May 2025, variable according to the technical improvement of each machine: the greatest degree of freedom is presented by the Era-Star 1 Robot. Therefore, do not expect great and unusual innovations regarding the degree of freedom of robots, they will be, until you see, limited and submissive to their creators. From a good creator a positive robot will emerge, from a bad creator, a negative one. A friend with whom I discussed the topic was very surprised by the fact that one of the most populous countries in the world is at the forefront of robotic development, because for him it would be more important to provide employment to a huge population than to seek to replace them in almost all tasks, from scientific to the most routine, such as the transport and delivery of goods. To understand why this total adherence to intelligent machinery, or as intelligent as its limited freedom allows, it is necessary to go back to the history of China. I propose a journey to the times of the emergence and development of the use of gunpowder. The appearance of gunpowder is associated with Alchemy and Taoist masters, who carried out the first scientific experiments in search of the elixir of longevity, already in the Warring States Period (战国 Zhàn Guó, 475-221 BC), being one of the four great inventions of Ancient China (四大发明Sì dà fāmíng). The first type of gunpowder to emerge was black gunpowder (黑火药Hēi huǒyào), the experiments of the alchemists were very well received and encouraged by the dominant power, then the experiments continued during the Eastern Han dynasty (东汉Dōng Hàn, 25-220), with the treatise by Wei Boyang (魏伯阳), entitled Zhouyi Cantongqi, being famous. (《周易参同契》), and translated as The Concordance of the Three, or that of the Jin dynasty (晋代Jìn dài, 266-420) by the great alchemist Ge Hong (葛洪), whose title is Baopuzi, in Portuguese, The Master Who Embraces Simplicity (《抱朴子·仙药篇》), especially its chapter dedicated to the manufacture of the pill of immortality. Perhaps when using combustion methods to create the pill, the alchemists discovered gunpowder by chance by mixing sulfur, saltpeter and charcoal. It is certain that the explosion occurred and the dangerous, flammable and detonating element was discovered, but it is no less certain that the masters did not follow this route, which they considered unproductive for the desired objective. Then only much later during the Song dynasty (宋代Sòng dài， 960-1279) is it known that some artisans established fireworks workshops in Kaifeng to produce rockets and fireworks indispensable for all great moments of celebration in China. The use of gunpowder then followed two very different paths, one pyrotechnic for recreational purposes of the imperial power and associated stately homes, the other for military use. Why is the story of the discovery of gunpowder brought here? Because this could perhaps contain the three dimensions that we can find in the creation and interest in robots in China. Its creation reveals an enormous scientific interest associated: on the one hand, with philosophical practices aimed at developing life to its limits and perhaps even their absence, which would be achieved by immortality; on the other, it expresses an immense recreational desire with deep emotional investment, and, on the other, a practical utility, which puts robotics at the forefront, both in scientific, military and civil terms. The new Chinese philosophy, as the oldest genuinely autochthonous one, appears in close connection with science and techniques with mysterious connections to the world of magic for the Taoist masters of yesterday, who are followed by the great doctors, including those of traditional Chinese medicine, who today find precious laboratory assistants carrying out work of great precision and minimal errors, since robots do not They get tired, they don't even bother, they do what is asked of them without any salary demands. Furthermore, in military terms this arsenal of machinery is an excellent alternative, as it saves lives, as it is complex and autonomous enough to do so. Obviously, of the many ethical issues associated with this exponential development of the new world of robotics and artificial intelligence, one seems essential, above all and, for now, in terms of biotechnical experimentation and related scientific research, which will be discussed below. First the example, taken from the development of dynamic electrodes for brain-computer interface, as is happening at the Shenzhen Institute of Advanced Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. In brain-computer interface systems, electrodes from electronic devices must be connected to the brain to acquire electroencephalographic signals. These electrodes are made of flexible fiber, similar to a worm, with a magnetic sensor incorporated in the head of the “worm”, to be manipulated according to the orientation of external magnetic fields. These flexible fiber electrodes were introduced into the brains of rabbits and also rats, with the aim of subsequently serving human clinical needs, such as intelligent control of prostheses, localization of epileptic lesions and treatment of chronic neurological disorders. From an ethical point of view, the question cannot help but be asked: why are human lives more important than all others on our planet? Human beings remain the kings of creation, even within the scope of philosophies such as the Chinese, whose non-humanist tradition, as referred to in Heidegger's Letter to Humanism, is well known. Are we humans really that valuable? Science must continue its path, which in China will always be followed from a pragmatic and utilitarian perspective for the benefit of the Chinese and the Chinese nation. But don't think that robotics is there just to serve Chinese society without exchanging favors, as we cannot forget the enormous emotional investment that the population that descends from Dragons makes in these new beings, some more bionic than others, who acquire the status of companions and friends and, in this capacity, have all the pampering that was previously due to the humans and animals they chose to cherish. The new Chinese philosophy is utilitarian, practical and has new entities in its world of knowledge, such as humanoids, bionic robots and robotics toys. They are highly esteemed and paving the way for a new era, that of cyborgs or better said, the mixed humanity of tomorrow, which will have the greatest chance of living long and, who knows, immortalizing itself. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: The number of suspicious transactions recorded in casinos fell by 9.5 percent in the first nine months of 2025, compared to the same period last year, according to official data. The Financial Information Office (GIF) reported that the six casino operators submitted, in total, 2,751 reports of transactions suspected of money laundering or terrorist financing. In a statement released on Thursday, GIF pointed to “the decrease in the number of reports of suspicious transactions reported by the gaming sector” until September as the main reason for an 8.9 percent drop in the total number. Between January and September, the office received 4,118 submissions, 73.3 percent of which came from casino concessionaires, while 21 percent came from banks and insurance companies and 5.7 percent from other institutions and entities. The referenced sectors, including pawn shops, jewelry stores, real estate agencies and auction houses, are obliged to report to the authorities any transaction equal to or greater than 500 thousand patacas. In 2024, GIF had received 5,245 participations, the majority of which came from the territory's casinos: 3,837, 11.8 percent more than in the previous year and a new record. Everyone agree According to GIF's annual report, Macau was the only member of the Asia-Pacific Anti-Money Laundering Group (FATF) that complied with “all 40 international standards” on preventing money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office signed agreements to exchange information with 33 countries and territories, including the Financial Information Unit of the Judicial Police of Portugal, in 2008, the Financial Information Unit of the Central Bank of Timor-Leste, in 2018, and, in 2019, the Financial Activities Control Council of Brazil and the Financial Information Unit of Cape Verde. In July, GIF said that it had finalized the procedures to sign, also with Angola, an information exchange agreement to prevent money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office said that the agreement was on the table at a meeting with representatives of the Financial Information Unit of the Republic of Angola, on the sidelines of the Egmont Group meeting between 6 and 11 July, in Luxembourg. The Egmont Group is an international anti-money laundering organization, which brings together 181 information units from around the world.
